definition: to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy

sentences.english: Foot binding was a cosmetic practice, not much different in its own way from breast implantations or nose reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 缠足是一种装饰行为，和隆胸或隆鼻殊途同归。

sentences.english: With regard to the origin of foot binding, different opinions.
sentences.chinese: 关于缠足的起源，说法不一。

sentences.english: Even if the woman was not binding feet was not easy to show people before.
sentences.chinese: 即使后来不缠足的女人脚也不轻易展示于人前。

sentences.english: The second part analyzed the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists from the aspects of thoughts and observations.
sentences.chinese: 从思想言论方面对戊戌维新派的不缠足进行阐述。

sentences.english: At ?rst, foot-binding was the sole privilege of the high class.
sentences.chinese: 起初，缠足还只是上等人的特权。

sentences.english: Han Chinese women had their feet bound.
sentences.chinese: 在汉代，中国女性必须缠足。

sentences.english: The fifth part was a basic summary to the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists.
sentences.chinese: 对戊戌时期维新派领导的不缠足运动的一个基本评析。

sentences.english: Sun ordered the ban to persuade foot-binding.

definition: foot-binding/long strip of cloth used for foot-binding
a woman's virtue is to have no talent (idiom)
pinyin: nu:3 zi3 wu2 cai2 bian4 shi4 de2

definition: Confucian moral injunctions for women, namely: obey in turn three men father, husband and son, plus the four virtues of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
to regard men as superior to women (idiom)
to drown a newborn baby (as method of infanticide)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
